page.title: 09Acklington Prisons
page.content: Since 1972,{two prisons}have been taking shape in Northumberland. They are called Acklington and Castington and stand on the site of the old R.A.F.station less than 2km south of Acklington Village. You can still see one of the large hangars which has been retained and converted into workshops. {Acklington,}at present, holds 460 men and is described as a training prison with an emphasis on industrial training and education. A proportion of the inmates are serving life sentences. The number of staff is 250. {Castington}Prison holds about 200 young offenders (aged 17-20) and these inmates are considered to be more of a security risk than those at Acklington Prison. The staff at Castington number about 130. Both prisons are still growing.
